t: Israel*pn empties his*i vine; He*ld brings forth fruit for himself. According*ld to the multitude of his fruit He*ld has increased the altars; According*ld to the bounty of his land They*ld have embellished his*i sacred*i pillars.
Their*ld heart is divided; Now*ld they are held guilty. He*ld will break down their altars; He*ld will ruin their sacred*i pillars.
For*ln now they say, “We*ld have no king, Because*ld we did not fear the Lord.*s And*ld as for a king, what would he do for us?”
They*ld have spoken words, Swearing*ld falsely in making a covenant. Thus*ld judgment springs up like hemlock in the furrows of the field.
The*ln inhabitants of Samaria fear Because*ld of the calf of Beth Aven. For*ld its people mourn for it, And*ld its priests shriek for it— Because*ld its glory has departed from it.
The*ild idol*i also shall be carried to Assyria As*ild a present for King Jareb. Ephraim*ld shall receive shame, And*ld Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
As*iln for*i Samaria, her king is cut off Like*ld a twig on the water.

Also*ld the high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, Shall*ld be destroyed. The*ld thorn and thistle shall grow on their altars; They*ld shall say to the mountains, “Cover us!” And*ld to the hills, “Fall on us!”
“O*ln Israel, you have sinned from the days of Gibeah; There*ld they stood. The*ld battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity Did*ld not overtake them.
When*ld it*i is*i My desire, I will chasten them. Peoples*ld shall be gathered against them When*ld I bind them for their two transgressions.
Ephraim*ld is*i a trained heifer That*ld loves to thresh grain;*i But*ld I harnessed her fair neck, I*ld will make Ephraim pull a*i plow.*i Judah*ld shall plow; Jacob*ld shall break his clods.”
Sow*ln for yourselves righteousness; Reap*ld in mercy; Break*ld up your fallow ground, For*ld it*i is*i time to seek the Lord,*s Till*ld He comes and rains righteousness on you.
You*ln have plowed wickedness; You*ld have reaped iniquity. You*ld have eaten the fruit of lies, Because*ld you trusted in your own way, In*ld the multitude of your mighty men.

Therefore*ld tumult shall arise among your people, And*ld all your fortresses shall be plundered As*ld Shalman plundered Beth Arbel in the day of battle— A*ld mother dashed in pieces upon her*i children.
Thus*ld it shall be done to you, O Bethel, Because*ld of your great wickedness. At*ld dawn the king of Israel Shall*ld be cut off utterly.
